enumeratedValue.description: Sleep mode request - The MSCAN enters sleep mode when CAN bus idle
Wakeup disabled - The MSCAN ignores traffic on CAN
Wakeup enabled - The MSCAN is able to restart
MSCAN is not synchronized to the CAN bus
MSCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus
The module is not affected during wait mode
The module ceases to be clocked during wait mode
MSCAN is receiving a message, including when arbitration is lost
No valid message was received since last clearing this flag
A valid message was received since last clearing of this flag
Initialization mode active - The MSCAN has entered initialization mode
Sleep mode active - The MSCAN has entered sleep mode
MSCAN wakes on any dominant level on the CAN bus
MSCAN wakes only in case of a dominant pulse on the CAN bus that has a length of Twup
Automatic bus-off recovery (see Bosch CAN 2.0A/B protocol specification)
MSCAN clock source is the oscillator clock
MSCAN clock source is the bus clock
Three samples per bit. In this case, PHASE_SEG1 must be at least 2 time quanta (Tq)
No new message available within the RxFG
The receiver FIFO is not empty. A new message is available in the RxFG

Bus-off: 256<=transmit error counter (Redundant Information for the most critical CAN bus status which is "bus-off". This only occurs if the Tx error counter exceeds a number of 255 errors. Bus-off affects the receiver state. As soon as the transmitter leaves its bus-off state the receiver state skips to RxOK too. Refer also to TSTAT[1:0] coding in this register. )
No change in CAN bus status occurred since last interrupt
MSCAN changed current CAN bus status
No wakeup activity observed while in sleep mode
MSCAN detected activity on the CAN bus and requested wakeup
No interrupt request is generated from this event
A receive buffer full (successful message reception) event causes a receiver interrupt request
No interrupt request is generated from this event
An overrun event causes an error interrupt request
Do not generate any CSCIF interrupt caused by transmitter state changes
Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the transmitter enters or leaves "bus-off" state. Discard other transmitter state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt
Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the transmitter enters or leaves "TxErr" or "bus-off" state. Discard other transmitter state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt
Generate CSCIF interrupt on all state changes
Do not generate any CSCIF interrupt caused by receiver state changes
Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the receiver enters or leaves "bus-off" state. Discard other receiver state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt

Generate CSCIF interrupt only if the receiver enters or leaves "RxErr" or "bus-off"Bus-off state is only defined for transmitters by the CAN standard (see Bosch CAN 2.0A/B protocol specification). Because the only possible state change for the transmitter from bus-off to TxOK also forces the receiver to skip its current state to RxOK, the coding of the RXSTAT[1:0] flags define an additional bus-off state for the receiver state. Discard other receiver state changes for generating CSCIF interrupt
Generate CSCIF interrupt on all state changes
No interrupt request is generated from this event
A CAN Status Change event causes an error interrupt request
No interrupt request is generated from this event
A wake-up event causes a Wake-Up interrupt request
The associated message buffer is full (loaded with a message due for transmission)
The associated message buffer is empty (not scheduled)
No interrupt request is generated from this event
A transmitter empty (transmit buffer available for transmission) event causes a transmitter empty interrupt request

register.name: CANTARQ
register.description: MSCAN Transmitter Message Abort Request Register

register.name: CANTAAK
register.description: MSCAN Transmitter Message Abort Acknowledge Register

enumeratedValue.description: The associated message buffer is deselected
The associated message buffer is selected, if lowest numbered bit

field.name: BOHOLD
field.description: Bus-off State Hold Until User Request

enumeratedValue.description: Module is not bus-off or recovery has been requested by user in bus-off state
Module is bus-off and holds this state until user request

register.name: CANIDAR%s
register.description: MSCAN Identifier Acceptance Register n of First Bank

register.name: CANIDMR%s
register.description: MSCAN Identifier Mask Register n of First Bank

enumeratedValue.description: Match corresponding acceptance code register and identifier bits
Ignore corresponding acceptance code register bit

register.name: CANIDAR%s
register.description: MSCAN Identifier Acceptance Register n of Second Bank

register.name: CANIDMR%s
register.description: MSCAN Identifier Mask Register n of Second Bank

enumeratedValue.description: Match corresponding acceptance code register and identifier bits
Ignore corresponding acceptance code register bit

register.name: REDSR%s
register.description: Receive Extended Data Segment Register N

register.name: TEDSR%s
register.description: Transmit Extended Data Segment Register N

register.name: TDLR
register.description: This register keeps the data length field of the CAN frame
